marklogic.body: I wouldn't call it blame either. People are just desperate to find another excuse to hang Melo's poor shooting on. Since Pringles is gone and Woodson has run more sets for him and Amar'e the only culprit that is left is Lin. But the fact was that Lin's shooting attempts went down in the second half against Philly, particularly in the 3rd quarter when the offense struggled the like crazy. Melo went dead Cold in that quarter and it wasn't anyone else's fault. Woodson decided to run more of the offense through STAT and Lin did his job. Look at the coach....
